posts.name: Goktug Yildiz
posts.cooked:
The text has been cleaned to focus on the essential details while preserving the original meaning. Here is the organized and concise version:

---

Hi Chief Delphi,

We were using YAGSL for our 2025 Comp Bot but since it isn't available for Systemcore, we're attempting to get 364's code working. We've encountered an issue where only the front-right module follows the joystick. When moving the joystick forward, the wheels shift sideways, and the back modules don't respond. We've double-checked the CAN communication offsets multiple times but haven't found the error.

Our hardware setup includes:
- Four Mk4iL2
- Four Cancoders
- One Pigeon2
- Eight NEOs

--- 

This version removes all unnecessary tags, maintains the key points, and ensures clear, grammatically correct English.

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: We measured offsets with all wheel bevel gears aligned toward the left side of the robot. When the joystick is pressed forward, the back wheels turn right and move forward, while the front wheels initially point straight ahead. However, the front-left module sometimes points in random directions. Interestingly, the front-right module consistently tracks the joystick direction without deviation. Swerve operates as intended with YAGS on Ro-borio using the same module configurations.
I could make a version for you that works with system core if you tell me what hardware you're using.

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: Thanks, what hardware information do you need? We have 4 x Mk4i L2, 4 x Cancoders, 1x Pigeon2 and 8x NEOs. Discord is banned in Turkey.

I will release a version for SC which supports only REV and CTRE in the next 48 hours. Please feel free to reach out to me here! I could also join another chat platform like Slack or create a workspace for you.

posts.name: Goktug Yildiz
posts.cooked: I'll join your discord in a short time

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: Thank you very much! That sounds great, I really appreciate it.
